Sentencas: The polarization behaviors of porous platinum and La(Sr)MnO3 (LSM) cathodes coupled with zirconia electrolytes with various ionic conductivities (sigma(ion)) were investigated.
Titulo: Effect of ionic conductivity of zirconia electrolytes on the polarization behavior of various cathodes in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The exchange current density, j(0), on Pt cathode was not influenced by the sigma(ion) at 900 and 1000 degrees C, whereas j(0) increased proportionally to sigma(ion) at a lower temperature of 800 degrees
Titulo: Effect of ionic conductivity of zirconia electrolytes on the polarization behavior of various cathodes in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: C. However, the j(0) on LSM cathodes increased in proportion to the sigma(ion) in the temperature region between 800 and 1000 degrees C.
Titulo: Effect of ionic conductivity of zirconia electrolytes on the polarization behavior of various cathodes in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The dispersion of nanometer-sized Pt catalysts on LSM particles greatly enhanced the performance, the magnitude of which depended on the temperature, the sigma(ion) and the microstructure of LSM.
Titulo: Effect of ionic conductivity of zirconia electrolytes on the polarization behavior of various cathodes in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The observations are well explained kinetically, i.e., the cathode performance is controlled by the transport rate of O2- at the interface when the surface reaction rate is sufficiently high.
Titulo: Effect of ionic conductivity of zirconia electrolytes on the polarization behavior of various cathodes in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Consequently, the use of high-performance electrodes in combination with the solid electrolyte having high sigma(ion) is very important for achieving the high performance of solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Effect of ionic conductivity of zirconia electrolytes on the polarization behavior of various cathodes in solid oxide fuel cells
